item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported the deterioration of Twitter’s service, days ahead of Elon Musk’s $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. […]

The post Reuters exclusively reports Twitter struggles to keep its most active users engaged ahead of Musk deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded: The post Reuters exclusively reports Twitter struggles to keep its most active users engaged ahead of Musk deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed Seagate Technology Holdings said in a filing that the U.S. government has warned the company that it […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed Seagate Technology Holdings said in a filing that the U.S. government has warned the company that it may have violated export control laws by providing hard disk drives to a customer that a source familiar with the situation identified as Huawei Technologies. Huawei is on the U.S. Commerce Department’s entity list and banned from receiving U.S. exports and certain foreign-made items without government approval.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. alleges Seagate broke export rules to sell Huawei hard drives appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals automakers to double spending on EVs, batteries to $1.2 trillion by 2030
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that the world’s top automakers are planning to spend nearly $1.2 trillion through 2030 to develop and […]

The post Reuters reveals automakers to double spending on EVs, batteries to $1.2 trillion by 2030 appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the world’s top automakers are planning to spend nearly $1.2 trillion through 2030 to develop and produce millions of electric vehicles, along with the batteries and raw materials to support that production. The electric vehicle investment figure, which has not previously been published, dwarfs previous investment estimates by Reuters and is more than twice the most recent calculation published just a year ago. 

The post Reuters reveals automakers to double spending on EVs, batteries to $1.2 trillion by 2030 appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters exclusively reveals SAP delays Russia exit as deal talks fail, workers at risk
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported German software group SAP will delay its exit from Russia months after it declared the company would […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals SAP delays Russia exit as deal talks fail, workers at risk appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported German software group SAP will delay its exit from Russia months after it declared the company would do so. The Reuters report examined the intricacies global companies like SAP faced trying to extricate from the controversial market. These problems include grappling with existing contractual obligations and facing pressure from the government over speedy exits. Moments before Reuters revealed the news, SAP confirmed the report, which helped wipe out $2.5 billion from its market cap before leveling off by the end of the trading day. Read on Eikon.

The post Reuters exclusively reveals SAP delays Russia exit as deal talks fail, workers at risk appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters took readers on a deep dive into how Japanese authorities are relying heavily on psychological tactics to fight yen […]

The post Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters took readers on a deep dive into how Japanese authorities are relying heavily on psychological tactics to fight yen bears, which means keeping markets guessing about their foreign exchange intervention rather than overt attempts to arrest the currency’s decline to multi-decade lows.

The post Will they or won’t they? Japan uses guessing game to shore up yen appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals scrambles for EV reboot with eye on Tesla
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report Toyota is considering a reboot of its electric-car strategy to better compete in a booming […]

The post Reuters reveals scrambles for EV reboot with eye on Tesla appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report Toyota is considering a reboot of its electric-car strategy to better compete in a booming market, and has halted some work on existing electric vehicle (EV) projects. The proposals under review, if adopted, would amount to a dramatic shift for Toyota and rewrite the $38-billion EV rollout plan the Japanese automaker announced last year to better compete with the likes of Tesla.

The post Reuters reveals scrambles for EV reboot with eye on Tesla appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals India rice export curbs to end a decade of price stability
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters shed light on how India’s recent curbs on rice exports could trigger a rally in global prices after more […]

The post Reuters reveals India rice export curbs to end a decade of price stability appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters shed light on how India’s recent curbs on rice exports could trigger a rally in global prices after more than a decade of stability, as New Delhi’s protectionist move coincides with falling output in other major producers and rising global demand.

The post Reuters reveals India rice export curbs to end a decade of price stability appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
